turns.speaker: TANNER
turns.text: You think this is funny motherfucker?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: I can't help it, Tanner, you hit like a fucking girl.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: I met the guy at a party.  He said he wanted to do a biggie. He's new in town so I offered my services.

turns.speaker: TANNER
turns.text: This chink have a name?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Bubba.

turns.speaker: TANNER
turns.text: You better not be blowing smoke up My ass, Flynne.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: After that ass-whipping you gave me?

turns.speaker: TANNER
turns.text: What're your taking down?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Standard vig.  Minus five for a certain blabber-mouth moron by the name of Jimmy the Finn, who's living proof that natural selection is a flawed theory.

turns.speaker: TANNER
turns.text: Did you really think you were slick enough to pull this off?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Look man, I just wanted to make some dough and disappear.  I didn't want to wait around for Domingo to figure out who doubled back on him.

turns.speaker: TANNER
turns.text: You've got no choice.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Whata you mean I've got no choice?

turns.speaker: TANNER
turns.text: Well, if you'd rather do a stretch in la casa grande ...

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: For that old possession charge? Gimme a break.

turns.speaker: TANNER
turns.text: No. You just handed us a new one.  We can go Federal on your ass right now: ongoing criminal conspiracy. Intent to buy and distribute $250,000 worth of crank.  What's the mandatory on that, Al?

turns.speaker: TANNER
turns.text: Bullshit. He's a liar.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: News-flash, Tanner. I'm a fucking rat.

turns.speaker: TANNER
turns.text: You think you're so god damned smart, don't you?

turns.speaker: TANNER
turns.text: That's because he doesn't have one.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Whata you mean?  He told me -

turns.speaker: TANNER
turns.text: Guy scores dope and dollar from ripping off other drug dealers.  As least that's what the word is.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: What's to stop him from just ripping me off then?

turns.speaker: TANNER
turns.text: That's probably what he would have done if we hadn't found out about your get-rich-quick scheme.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: What? Is it bad?

turns.speaker: TANNER
turns.text: I'm afraid so, Danny.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Who is it?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: That's real sweet, Garcetti.  Thanks.

turns.speaker: TANNER
turns.text: We got the 411 on your good old boy.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Murder.  Beautiful.

turns.speaker: TANNER
turns.text: Pumped fifty-seven bullets into a police informant.

turns.speaker: TANNER
turns.text: Took a pig-slicker to the heart.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Jesus.

turns.speaker: TANNER
turns.text: I thought you'd be happy.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: TANNER
turns.text: Danny?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: My name is Tom.

turns.speaker: TANNER
turns.text: Whatever you say, man.  Look ... can we talk about this?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Yeah. Okay. Listen carefully ...  You're in the bathroom.  You've been shot in the shoulder ...

turns.speaker: TANNER
turns.text: Please ... don't do this ...

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Answer the fucking question!

turns.speaker: GARCETTI
turns.text: This the guy?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: It speaks!

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: That's him.  He's a lot prettier in person though.

turns.speaker: GARCETTI
turns.text: Cut to the fucking chase, Flynne.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Dude is bugging.  Transparent spiders, plastic men - the whole nine yards.

turns.speaker: GARCETTI
turns.text: What's he holding?

turns.speaker: GARCETTI
turns.text: Then why didn't you help the kid when you were there?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Hey, you want me to do all your work for you, numbnuts?

turns.speaker: GARCETTI
turns.text: I'll tell you why you didn't help - because you're a chickenshit tweaking snitch.  You're a bottom feader, Flynne.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Garcetti, you're teeth, they're fucking perfect.

turns.speaker: GARCETTI
turns.text: Danny, it's really pains me to have to tell you this, but do you remember DOMINGO, that wetback you helped us put away for trafficking a few months back?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Yeah.  What about him?

turns.speaker: GARCETTI
turns.text: Turns out he's connected.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: To who?

turns.speaker: GARCETTI
turns.text: The Mexicali Boys

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: And what does this have to do with me?

turns.speaker: GARCETTI
turns.text: He knows somebody ratted him.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: What?!

turns.speaker: GARCETTI
turns.text: And he's making a lot of noise about having his homies hang a Colombian necktie on whoever it was.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Fuck you, Garcetti. I been at this for almost a year. I've done everything you guys have asked of me.

turns.speaker: GARCETTI
turns.text: Anyone ever ask you to be such a disrespectful smart-ass all the time?

turns.speaker: GARCETTI
turns.text: We know what's going on.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: I still don't know what you're talking about.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Jimmy?

turns.speaker: GARCETTI
turns.text: Who the hell is Jimmy?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: He's the only one I told.

turns.speaker: GARCETTI
turns.text: And he probably only told two people and they probably only told four people and on and one. You know better than to tell a secret to a tweaker, Flynne.  Might just as well broadcast it on the evening news.

turns.speaker: GARCETTI
turns.text: What's on the other end of this thing?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Now that I can help you with. Nasty boy ... goes by the name of Pooh-Bear. He's a chef. Check with Palmdale P.D. I'm sure they're keeping box scores on the guy.

turns.speaker: GARCETTI
turns.text: Sounds like you hooked up with some fine citizens, Flynne.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Oh they're all that and the proverbial bag of chips.

turns.speaker: GARCETTI
turns.text: What's that smell?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: That would be me.

turns.speaker: GARCETTI
turns.text: What'd you do, piss your pants?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Hell, yes!  What the hell do you expect zapping Mr. Johnson with that crackler?

turns.speaker: GARCETTI
turns.text: Who'd have thought it?  Danny "Chickenshit" Flynne trying to go large right under our noses.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Lay off, Garcetti.  I'm not in the mood.

turns.speaker: GARCETTI
turns.text: No.  You've got me all wrong.  I mean, in you own pussified way, you actually got some nuts in your little sack.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Excuse me?

turns.speaker: GARCETTI
turns.text: Several possession charges, but nothing major.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Why doesn't Palmdale P.D. just raid the guy?

turns.speaker: GARCETTI
turns.text: They have. But they never found a lab.

turns.speaker: GARCETTI
turns.text: You're lucky, Flynne.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Funny, I don't feel lucky.

turns.speaker: GARCETTI
turns.text: We're coordinating with Palmdale P.D.. We'll have your sorry ass covered.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: What if he caps me before you can make a move?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Speaking of which ... you run that license plate for me?

turns.speaker: GARCETTI
turns.text: You mean the menacing red car?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Come on! Who is it?  Domingo's boys?

turns.speaker: GARCETTI
turns.text: Worse. Much worse.  A teacher.

turns.speaker: GARCETTI
turns.text: When is the deal going down?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: I'm making the small buy tonight ... if I don't get beaten to death with a wheelchair or something.  If everyone is happy, we'll do the big deal later in the week.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: You know, I'm starting to think I'd rather take my chances with Domingo than go through any more of this shit.

turns.speaker: GARCETTI
turns.text: Didn't you hear?  Domingo's dead.

turns.speaker: GARCETTI
turns.text: Nervous?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: With you clowns watching my back? What do you think?

turns.speaker: LIZ
turns.text: A virtuoso rendition.  TOM VAN ALLEN is nothing short of dazzling in his interpretation of Miles Davis' haunting, moody piece.

turns.speaker: DANNY/TOM
turns.text: Thank you.  Thank you very much.

turns.speaker: LIZ
turns.text: And he has a really hot ass with hardly any hair on it.

turns.speaker: DANNY/TOM
turns.text: Again, I thank you.

turns.speaker: LIZ
turns.text: I was talking about Miles.

turns.speaker: DANNY/TOM
turns.text: You, madam, are a heartless wench.

turns.speaker: LIZ
turns.text: And you've got wiener breath.

turns.speaker: DANNY/TOM
turns.text: Really?

turns.speaker: LIZ
turns.text: It's that disgusting hot dog you had for lunch.

turns.speaker: LIZ
turns.text: Tom, let's spend the night here.

turns.speaker: DANNY/TOM
turns.text: There's no motels around here.

turns.speaker: LIZ
turns.text: No.  Right here on the beach.  Come on. Let's do it.

turns.speaker: LIZ
turns.text: Why didn't you just ask for directions back there?

turns.speaker: DANNY/TOM
turns.text: Come on, where's your pioneer spirit?

turns.speaker: LIZ
turns.text: You mean like the Donner Party?

turns.speaker: DANNY/TOM
turns.text: Hey, do you think you could eat me if you had to?  And if so, which part do you think you would find the most delicious?

turns.speaker: LIZ
turns.text: Tom, quit fucking around.

turns.speaker: DANNY/TOM
turns.text: Okay, okay.  There's a house up there. I'll go ask for directions.

turns.speaker: LIZ
turns.text: You think that's a good idea?

turns.speaker: DANNY/TOM
turns.text: What do you mean?

turns.speaker: LIZ
turns.text: Look at that place. It's creepy.

turns.speaker: DANNY/TOM
turns.text: First you want me to ask for directions, then you don't.  Which is it?

turns.speaker: LIZ
turns.text: I wanted you to ask back there.  You know, before you got us lost.

turns.speaker: DANNY/TOM
turns.text: Just no pleasing you, is there?

turns.speaker: LIZ
turns.text: Just admit you're wrong.

turns.speaker: DANNY/TOM
turns.text: We all know how much you like hearing that. Okay, Liz, I was wrong. There.  You happy?

turns.speaker: LIZ
turns.text: Quit feeling sorry for yourself, Tom. It gets old.

turns.speaker: DANNY/TOM
turns.text: No. You know what gets old? Being reminded what a loser you are every time you screw up.

turns.speaker: LIZ
turns.text: Here it comes, poor Tom.

turns.speaker: DANNY/TOM
turns.text: But that's okay, Liz, you're the one with the steady job, you pay all the bills. I'm just an unemployed musician.  You have every right.

turns.speaker: LIZ
turns.text: That is so unfair.

turns.speaker: DANNY/TOM
turns.text: My sentiments exactly.

turns.speaker: LIZ
turns.text: Why are you doing this?

turns.speaker: GARCETTI
turns.text: You thinking what I'm thinking?

turns.speaker: TANNER
turns.text: Yeah.  This could be the one we're looking for.

turns.speaker: TANNER
turns.text: And believe me, word will get out that you're a pro rat.

turns.speaker: GARCETTI
turns.text: That's not good in prison. It's just not good.

turns.speaker: TANNER
turns.text: Golly, I hadn't thought of that.

turns.speaker: GARCETTI
turns.text: Don't we always take good care of you?

turns.speaker: GARCETTI
turns.text: She's 57 and she's been teaching third grade for the last 33 years.

turns.speaker: TANNER
turns.text: Now that's scary!

turns.speaker: TANNER
turns.text: We're in business.

turns.speaker: GARCETTI
turns.text: Good work, Flynne.  You're a first-rate rat.

turns.speaker: GARCETTI
turns.text: Just make sure you hit the floor when we come in. It could get ugly in there.

turns.speaker: TANNER
turns.text: Yeah, I'd hate to shoot you by accident.

turns.speaker: TANNER
turns.text: Where's Bubba?

turns.speaker: GARCETTI
turns.text: Maybe he isn't showing.

turns.speaker: KUJO
turns.text: Danny, listen up.  Here's the deal ... my wife's pimp knows a guy who works at Cedars Sinai medical lab.  They're getting a very special delivery a week from this Friday.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: What is it, drugs?

turns.speaker: KUJO
turns.text: Better than drugs.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: What is that? Rum and coke?

turns.speaker: KUJO
turns.text: Don't worry about it.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: I just want to be straight on the details.  Can I taste it?

turns.speaker: KUJO
turns.text: No, you can't taste it.  It's the fucking lab! Now shut up.

turns.speaker: KUJO
turns.text: Jesus Jimmy, you at the alpha team.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: I thought you were done.

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: Find a chaplain.

turns.speaker: COLONEL ANDERSON
turns.text: ...alright, let me know when.

turns.speaker: COLONEL ANDERSON
turns.text: Report.

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: Sector four is secured, we put out the last three German one-fifty-fives, found them about two miles in from Ponte du Hoc.

turns.speaker: COLONEL ANDERSON
turns.text: Resistance?

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: A company, Wehrmacht, no artillery, we took twenty-three prisoners, turned them over to intelligence.

turns.speaker: COLONEL ANDERSON
turns.text: Casualties?

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: Fourty-four, twenty one dead.

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: They didn't want to give up those one-fifty-fives, sir.

turns.speaker: COLONEL ANDERSON
turns.text: It was a hard assignment, that's why you got it.

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: Yes, sir.

turns.speaker: COLONEL ANDERSON
turns.text: Where are your men now?

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: Pinned down, a mile east of here, waiting for some help from the navy guns.

turns.speaker: COLONEL ANDERSON
turns.text: I'm sending Simpson to take over for you, the division is going to Caen, you're not coming with us, I have something else for you.

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: Sir?

turns.speaker: COLONEL ANDERSON
turns.text: There's a Private James Ryan who parachuted in with the Hundred-and- First near Ramelle.  I want you to take a squad up there.  If he's alive, bring him back to the beach for debarkation.  Take whoever you need, you've got your pick of the company.

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: A private, sir?

turns.speaker: COLONEL ANDERSON
turns.text: He's the last of four brothers, the other three were killed in action. This is straight from the Chief of Staff.

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: But, sir...I...I...

turns.speaker: COLONEL ANDERSON
turns.text: Spit it out, Captain.

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: Respectfully, sir, sending men all the way up to Ramelle to save one private doesn't make a fucking, goddamned bit of sense.  Sir.

turns.speaker: COLONEL ANDERSON
turns.text: Alright, I'll give you that. Continue.

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: The numbers don't make sense, sir. His brothers are dead, that's too bad, but they're out of the equation. Sending men up there is bleeding heart crapola from three thousand miles away.  One private is simply not worth a squad.  Colonel anderson This one is.  He's worth a lot more than that.  Which is why I'm sending you, you're the best field officer there is.

turns.speaker: COLONEL ANDERSON
turns.text: Good luck, John.

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: Thank you, sir.

turns.speaker: UPHAM
turns.text: So, where are you from?

turns.speaker: JACKSON
turns.text: You writin' a book or somethin'?

turns.speaker: UPHAM
turns.text: As a matter of fact, I am.

turns.speaker: JACKSON
turns.text: Figured.

turns.speaker: JACKSON
turns.text: I'm Jackson.  I'm from West Fork, Tennessee.  My pappy's a preacher. Him and his two brothers got a ministry, The Blessed Church of the Wandering Gospel.

turns.speaker: UPHAM
turns.text: In West Fork?

turns.speaker: JACKSON
turns.text: In the back of a nineteen and thirty- one stretch Hudson with a big ole' trailer.

turns.speaker: UPHAM
turns.text: No kidding.

turns.speaker: JACKSON
turns.text: I don't make jokes about things of, or related to, the preaching of the Holy Gospel, including the ministerial calling of my family.

turns.speaker: UPHAM
turns.text: So they travel around from place to place and preach?

turns.speaker: JACKSON
turns.text: We got us a tent, forty-two feet across, eighteen feet at center, hundred-and-ten foldin' chairs. Circuit's eleven towns, covers all 'a Hasset County and most 'a Weller County.  I expect that upon completion of my military service I will be joinin' said ministry.

turns.speaker: UPHAM
turns.text: What about the Captain?  Where's he from?

turns.speaker: JACKSON
turns.text: Thirty-ought-six, Norton long-barrel with dual-groove, parallel rifling, elevated three-glass scope and a single-throw hammer.

turns.speaker: UPHAM
turns.text: The Army gave you that?

turns.speaker: JACKSON
turns.text: Yep.

turns.speaker: UPHAM
turns.text: You must be a hell a shot.

turns.speaker: JACKSON
turns.text: Not where I come from.

turns.speaker: UPHAM
turns.text: That must be four thousand yards.

turns.speaker: JACKSON
turns.text: Forty-two-hundred, I figure.

turns.speaker: UPHAM
turns.text: You take account of the wind?

turns.speaker: UPHAM
turns.text: Did you see what he did, back there? He stepped right into the open, so I could get across.

turns.speaker: JACKSON
turns.text: Shit, that was no big deal.

turns.speaker: REIBEN
turns.text: Jackson?

turns.speaker: JACKSON
turns.text: Hell, no, last time I shot a corporal, Cap'n Miller near bit my head off.

turns.speaker: REIBEN
turns.text: No one's gonna win the money for the simple reason that the Captain never was a civilian.  They assembled him at O.C.S. out of spare body parts from dead G.I.'s.  I know this for a fact.

turns.speaker: JACKSON
turns.text: You got somethin' against the Cap'n?

turns.speaker: REIBEN
turns.text: Hell, no.  I think he's the best officer in the whole goddamned army, bar none.

turns.speaker: REIBEN
turns.text: If we find Ryan and he's still alive, that son-of-a-bitch is gonna carry this goddamned B.A.R. back to the beach for me.

turns.speaker: JACKSON
turns.text: Army life is too dang easy, my feet have gone soft.  Back home, we go out squirrel huntin', I walk forever and a day and then some, don't even raise a blister.

turns.speaker: REIBEN
turns.text: You know what a B.A.R. weighs? Nineteen and a half pounds, not counting ammo.  And you think these things are comfortable?  They may look good but they weigh twelve pounds each, that's thirty-six pounds, right there.

turns.speaker: JACKSON
turns.text: Reiben, how many time I got to tell you, I'm from Tennessee.

turns.speaker: REIBEN
turns.text: They got squirrels there, too, right?

turns.speaker: JACKSON
turns.text: Last I knew.

turns.speaker: REIBEN
turns.text: Wade, Sarge, Corporal Insect, all of us, hell, I'll bet even the Captain has a mother.

turns.speaker: REIBEN
turns.text: Fuck Private James Ryan, fuck him, just fuck the goddamned son-of-a- bitch.

turns.speaker: JACKSON
turns.text: Shut up, will you?

turns.speaker: REIBEN
turns.text: You shut up, this is the most fucked up mission I ever heard of.  Goddamned Ryan, fuck the little bastard.

turns.speaker: JACKSON
turns.text: Just shut up, Ryan didn't kill Wade.

turns.speaker: REIBEN
turns.text: The hell he didn't.

turns.speaker: REIBEN
turns.text: You know what the best possible thing that could happen is?

turns.speaker: JACKSON
turns.text: Yep, you step on a rusty nail, get lockjaw, never say another word as long as you live.

turns.speaker: JACKSON
turns.text: So, that's Ryan.

turns.speaker: REIBEN
turns.text: Looks like a flaming asshole to me.

turns.speaker: REIBEN
turns.text: He's right, we can't shoot him...well, we could but we'd get in an enormous amount of trouble.  And he's right about the bridge, it's a hell of a lot more important than he is.

turns.speaker: JACKSON
turns.text: Cap'n...?

turns.speaker: JACKSON
turns.text: Yes, sir.

turns.speaker: REIBEN
turns.text: Of course, sir.

turns.speaker: REIBEN
turns.text: Y'all come back.

turns.speaker: JACKSON
turns.text: Reiben, are you makin' fun 'a the way I talk?

turns.speaker: REIBEN
turns.text: Hell, no!

turns.speaker: REIBEN
turns.text: What do you think?

turns.speaker: JACKSON
turns.text: I think I'm we got that eighty-eight.

turns.speaker: REIBEN
turns.text: I mean, Ryan, what do you think of him?

turns.speaker: JACKSON
turns.text: He ain't half-bad, I guess.

turns.speaker: REIBEN
turns.text: I guess.

turns.speaker: JACKSON
turns.text: He ain't Wade.

turns.speaker: REIBEN
turns.text: Nope, he ain't Wade.

turns.speaker: REIBEN
turns.text: Well, I'll be goddamned, I knew it.

turns.speaker: JACKSON
turns.text: Like hell, you did.

turns.speaker: JACKSON
turns.text: No kiddin'?

turns.speaker: REIBEN
turns.text: What deal?

turns.speaker: JACKSON
turns.text: Me?  I'm walking with my hound, Lucy, it's about an hour 'fore sunrise and we're out huntin' coon.  I got me a flask of pure Kentucky mash whiskey...

turns.speaker: REIBEN
turns.text: Jackson, how many times I got to tell you, you're from Tennessee.

turns.speaker: JACKSON
turns.text: I am, but I like imported whiskey. So there I am and I hear the biggest ole' coon you ever did hear, 'a rustlin' right there in front of me. That ole' boy comes right out of the brush, I got a clear shot and he knows he's 'bout to meet his maker. I aim, I got my finger tight on the trigger and then I just smile and say to that ole' coon, go on, now, you get out 'a here.  Then I sit down on a hollow log and take me a right long pull a' that mash whiskey.

turns.speaker: JACKSON
turns.text: Captain, my feet are most uncomfortable.  If I'd 'a known we was gonna have to walk all the way to Ramelle, I never would 'a volunteered for this here mission.

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: You didn't volunteer, Jackson.

turns.speaker: JACKSON
turns.text: I most likely would have, sir, had I been given the opportunity.

turns.speaker: JACKSON
turns.text: Sir, I have an opinion on this matter.

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: I'd love to hear it.

turns.speaker: JACKSON
turns.text: Seems to me, Cap'n, this mission is a serious misallocation of valuable military resources.  Miller Go on.

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: Reiben, I want you to listen closely to Jackson.  This is the way to gripe. Jackson, continue.

turns.speaker: JACKSON
turns.text: Yes, sir.  It seems to me, sir, that the entire resources of the United States Army oughta be dedicated to one thing and one thing only, and that is to put me and this here weapon on a rooftop, smack-dab in the middle of Berlin, Germany.  Now I ain't one to question decisions made up on high, sir, but it seems to me that saving one private, no matter how grievous the losses of his family, is a waste of my God-given talent.

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: Wade?

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: Where?

turns.speaker: JACKSON
turns.text: In the shadow by those two trees.

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: My guess, too.

turns.speaker: JACKSON
turns.text: We left them eighty-eights.

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: They don't send planes to put out machine guns.  Two flank runners with surpressing fire.  I'm going right, whoever goes left has to be fast.

turns.speaker: JACKSON
turns.text: Watching.

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: Gives Wade the second shot.

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: What the hell's the matter with you, Jackson?

turns.speaker: JACKSON
turns.text: Sir, I ain't feeling so chipper on account of Wade.

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: Who's Wade?

turns.speaker: JACKSON
turns.text: Sir, I understand what you're doin', but I respectfully request permission to grieve in my own manner.

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: You'll grieve the way I tell you to goddamned grieve.  There is no Wade, there was one, but he died a long time ago, he's been dead for so long you can hardly remember his name, you understand?

turns.speaker: JACKSON
turns.text: Sir, I understand.  I don't like it, but I understand.

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: Good, now get your goddamned gear.

turns.speaker: JACKSON
turns.text: Not yet.

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: Keep trying.

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: I'm in my backyard, lying in my hammock, with my arm around my wife, listening for the sound of breaking glass.

turns.speaker: JACKSON
turns.text: Say what, Cap'n?

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: You see, I've got the best house in all of Addley.  It's not the biggest house, but it's got the best location, right next to the junior high baseball field.  The garage windows face left field.  The guy who owned the house before me had these heavy screen S put over them.  The first thing I did when I bought the place was take off those screens.  Two-hundred-twenty- two yards from home plate to my garage windows.  It takes a hell of a junior high kid to hit a ball that far.  I look at my garage windows as a Motivator and a way to scout the kids coming up, the ones who are going to give us a shot at the state championship.  I lay there in my hammock and every time I hear the sound of breaking glass, I know we're one step closer to winning it all.

turns.speaker: JACKSON
turns.text: Don't that get kind of expensive, Cap'n?

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: It's worth it.

turns.speaker: JACKSON
turns.text: To each, his own.

turns.speaker: SUPPLY SERGEANT
turns.text: Sorry, sir, fresh out of trucks, how 'bout a '38 Ford Roadster, hard-top, red with black interior.

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: White-walls?

turns.speaker: SUPPLY SERGEANT
turns.text: No white-walls, sir, there's a war on.  NOT THERE, YOU GODDAMNED IDIOT, OVER THERE!  I can't help you, sir.

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: A half-track, anything.

turns.speaker: SUPPLY SERGEANT
turns.text: Sorry, sir.  Division is using everything on wheels to get up to Caen.  How come you guys aren't going?

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: How about that jeep?

turns.speaker: SUPPLY SERGEANT
turns.text: That's General Gavin's.  His lap dog told me if anyone breathes on it, I'll get busted and if anyone so much as touches it with their little finger, I'll get court marshaled. If you were to take it, they'd shoot me.

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: A paratrooper named Ryan.  He's going home, if he's alive.

turns.speaker: SUPPLY SERGEANT
turns.text: Senator's son?

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: No, three brothers of his were killed in action.  Command wants him out of there.

turns.speaker: UPHAM
turns.text: I know about bracketing.  I read about it.  The next one is going to land right on us.

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: FORWARD!  FORWARD!  NOW REVERSE!

turns.speaker: UPHAM
turns.text: You can tell all that, just by the sound, sire?

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: That's not all.  There were nine gunners on the eighty-eights, one had a broken heel on his boot, two had bratwurst for supper last night, one of them is named Fritz, the other, Hans, maybe, I don't know, it's hard to tell.

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: Glad of it.

turns.speaker: UPHAM
turns.text: On the other side of the street, crouches in a doorway with Jackson. Upham is a bit in shock, less from the nearness of the bullets than from what Miller just did for him.

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: DASHES across the street.

turns.speaker: UPHAM
turns.text: Sir, I'm sorry about what happened, I...

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: It was nothing.

turns.speaker: UPHAM
turns.text: But you could have gotten killed and I...

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: Like I said, it was nothing.  Don't bunch up.

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: Upham?

turns.speaker: UPHAM
turns.text: Pass.

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: Sarge?

turns.speaker: UPHAM
turns.text: I wasn't made for this.

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: You think the rest of us were?

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: It looks like a Renoir.

turns.speaker: UPHAM
turns.text: Yes.  Do you know Sibelius' Fourth Symphony, The Normandy?

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: I've been humming it.

turns.speaker: UPHAM
turns.text: I heard.

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: It seemed appropriate.

turns.speaker: UPHAM
turns.text: You know classical music?

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: Some.

turns.speaker: UPHAM
turns.text: Where are you from, Captain?

turns.speaker: UPHAM
turns.text: Over three-hundred.

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: I'll tell you what, if I'm still alive when it hits five-hundred, I'll let you know and we'll split the money.

turns.speaker: UPHAM
turns.text: If that's the way you feel, why don't we wait until it's up to a thousand.

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: I don't expect to live that long.

turns.speaker: UPHAM
turns.text: Five nights ago, he found this paratrooper caught in a tree with a broken leg.  The leg got infected. Last night he went to Ville Cholet to get a doctor.  The doctor refused to come and when he got back, this is what he found.  The Krauts must have shown up while he was gone.

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: Did he see any sign of them?
